awd_titl_txt: Scientific Illustration as Science Instruction Tool
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal will enable the principal investigator to determine               the extent of scientific illustration techniques in                             non-illustration courses make a contribution to helping students                and researchers develop their  ability to see, record and                       understand the world around them.                                                                                                                               The United States faces a crisis in science and mathematics                     education.  Although many causes have been suggested for the                    crisis, methods for instruction are high on most lists.  The                    University of Arizona has developed highly innovative ways to                   helping students visualize scientific and mathematical concepts                 and to discover things for themselves.  Visual methods are                      especially important in the biological sciences where concepts,                 structures and principles are often inherently visual.  These                   changes improve the quality of all instruction and make it more                 assessable to those at a disadvantage with normal instructional                 methods.
